Staff was very helpful and always there to help you on the way being a tourist craving for information or using the facilities of the hotel.

reviews.text: Roman Emperors must have relaxed within the high walls of Augusta Treverorum, so did I, while staying at (the 100% German female run?) Villa Hügel. Likely more peaceful and comfortable than during Roman times, you will be pampered as any Roman Emperor could have wished.
reviews.title: Veni, vidi, vici

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You will be welcomed with "how was your journey?", before being guided to your room and asked whether everything is fine with you. Once settled in the unpretentious lobby, you will be asked about any drink at this stage. You will then move to a very nice dining room that really deserves dining-in, provided you like the quiet way. Food is delicious, with several vegetarian items available. The suggested local dry white wine, I can't recall the name, is a good choice.
reviews.title: Nice Quiet Hotel, But A Bit Too Far From Town

reviews.text: Also, I cannot recall the name of the lovely blond lady proposing bathrobes and slippers or anything else needed to enjoy the swimming pool area.
reviews.title: I can't recommend this hotel highly enough!!

reviews.text: The comfort room (I had "Göttingen") is roomy, pleasant, well equipped and very quiet. There are magazines and books available and free internet in the lobby. Depending on your room, you might have some view on the City of Trier - if this is essential, I would recommend to check this at the time of booking.

reviews.text: The Villa Hügel is a great place to stay with a gracious, very professional staff. On site parking is also great. It is a 15 minute walk to the Hauptmarkt area. Best breakfast in Europe with an outstanding selection of things to eat. Highly Recommend this Villa. Did not get to use the indoor pool, but it looked great. Would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Super clean, Great place to stay"

reviews.text: This is a quaint B & B and appears very clean. They are located quite a distance from the city center which was an issue since I asked was was told they were centrally located.
reviews.title: Quaint B & B but misleading

reviews.text: More importantly, by email and telephone I was specific that we needed a separate bed for each of my adult sons. I know rooms and beds are small in Europe and wanted to be sure we were comfortable. Turns out they were double-bedded rooms, which was not acceptable. One room was very small and the other adequate. When the clerk on duty insisted we pay for one night. I suggested we rough it and then I'm advised one room is no longer available. It appears she booked it while we were considering what to do and intended to charge for it. Additionally, the clerk presented my reservation minus the page wherein I said a bed for each adult. The manager then arrived and agreed to waive the one night cancellation fee.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel, Great Service

reviews.text: She recommended another hotel and made a call. When we checked into that hotel we did not say Villa Huegel referred us and paid $50 less per room.
reviews.title: Epitome of perfection

reviews.text: Too much time was spent trying to get past the clerks deceiptions. That is unfortunate because the Hotel Villa Huegel is a nice property if you want to be away from town. I recommend you bring along your inquiries.
reviews.title: Stay here when staying in Trier!

reviews.text: This hotel is a lovely find. I'd return again to Trier just to stay there. Front desk greeting was professional and friendly, with excellent English. Our room was very large, with a huge bathroom. The pool is immaculately clean, quiet and relaxing. Drinks are served poolside.
reviews.title: Lovely independent hotel; would definitely come back again

likes.liked: — Atmosphere, room size, superb breakfast buffet, friendly staff, location
likes.disliked: — Our room faced the parking lot -- ask for a room on the opposite side

reviews.text: The comlimentary breakfast has an incredible selection of high quality foods. Best free breakfast buffet I've had at a hotel -- ever. We dined in the dining room on three nights. Small menu but good quality food and friendly service. Eating out on the terrasse was lovely and afforded a nice view over Trier, including some roman bath ruins. The hotel was a nice 15 minute walk to downtown Trier. The hotel had a friendly atmosphere; fhe staff was excellent and the place was spotless. I would return again in a heartbeat. The hotel was also a very good value. I feel like we got a lot of hotel and food for the money.
reviews.title: Beautiful little luxurious hotel
A little luxury never hurt anyone!
reviews.text: Stayed here with my wife and a few friends for a weekend in September and could not have been more pleased with the coziness and excellent service of this hotel. Granted, its not a big hotel like a Marriott or Four Seasons, but if you're looking for a small independant hotel that offers you the same luxury amenities then i recommend this place.
